title.narrative: Model for collaborative and cost-effective farmer assistance

description.narrative: In Brazil, we work together with companies, farmer cooperatives and associations to implement digital technical assistance tools, to fine tune and strengthen their service provision models, and to (re)train their extension workers. Our digital tools allow farmer associations and cooperatives to reshape their services to fit better the farmers’ needs, and to make their Technical Assistance (TA) more effective. Extension workers have access to custom work plans based on farmer assessments, and so provide tailored support to the farmers. In 2020 we have been working with 19 sugarcane farmer associations and 1 cocoa farmer organization reaching 6,658 farmers. We have also supported 263 citrus producers through digital channels. Together with our partner Raízen, the biggest sugarcane milling group in the world, we reached 26 mills and their 2,152 sugarcane suppliers. Through these interventions we brought 478,377 hectares under sustainable management practices. From 2021 onwards, Raízen will continue implementing the Technical Assistance model and Solidaridad tools and data-advisory support at own cost. The work with the sugarcane farmer associations in 2020, was partly hampered by Covid-19 restrictions, reducing the outreach by 10%. However, the collected data through different digital tools gave the associations a much better insight in farmers’ needs and priorities, and helped the associations to re-shape the services to its members. In collaboration with SENAR (National Rural Learning Service), we continued gathering data from coffee farmers to develop a strategy to incorporate a Climate-smart Agriculture (CSA) component to the portfolio of rural advisory services in Minas Gerais. In cocoa, we started to develop the business case for the Technical Assistance service provision, which is being tested by Coopercau (farmers cooperative). We also supported Cargill and Olam to develop sustainability criteria to implement their barter scheme, which has the potential to become a rewarding mechanism for smallholder farmers that apply zero-deforestation practices. This would bring sustainability to the core of the value chain by embedding a reward mechanism that represents more productivity and income to the producers. Together with Cutrale, one of the main orange juice processing industries in the world, and its main buyers, Coca-Cola, Eckes-Granini and Innocent Drinks, we are reaching producers through online training, local partners and remote assistance. This initiative was in its first stages and it was heavily affected by the Covid-19 pandemic because field visits are key for the trust-building process, and we could reach most of them only through digital media. We expect to make up for this in 2021, provided that the Covid-19 situation in Brazil improves.

Total: 469,651 hectares
Elo:sum of hectares of producers who have given the expected answer for 80% or more for the set of questions the compose the indicator (list of questions available under request). From Jan/19 to March/19 the data was collected through RHES, while from April to December, through ES. The number is the sum of both results. Obs1: if the farmer was assessed in both platform, only ES result is accounted; Obs2: we consider the farmers the have answered 80% or more of questions that compose the indicator. Obs3: Not applicable = compliance. 366,905 cumulative 17,810 new/absolute 440, 044 achievements cumulative AP 2020

comment.narrative: During 2019 we focussed on building partnerships, developing the proposal, and the strategy of the baseline, including all materials necessary, such as the questionnaire benchmark against FSA/SAI. Solidaridad team also visited partners.

title.narrative: # of farmers/miners/workers (m/f) trained to adopt good practices

comment.narrative: The strategy of the coffee project in 2019 was to create content and plan actions, in addition to agreements with the partner (SENAR) to define the fundamental areas for them, Solidaridad and producers. As a result, we did not carry out field activities with producers in 2019. Therefore, we will pass the 2019 target next year.

title.narrative: # of farmers/miners/workers (m/f) trained to adopt good practices

comment.narrative: Producers in groups 1, 2 and 3

title.narrative: # of farmers/miners/workers (m/f) trained to adopt good practices

comment.narrative: Sugarcane ELO: 2,017 (1,280 cumulative from 2018) Producers who were visited at least once in 2019 (RHES & ES) Sugarcane MC: 3,182 Score methodology: Number of farmers and farmers association team that received trainings. 1) Directly: collective trainings at farmers associations and technicians groups; field visits and 2) Indirectly: digital tools (Farming and Extension Solution); mass training (CanaTube). Results explanation: the project is supporting the farmers association to developed the trainings required by producers but the audience was less than expected in the events. In that case, the lesson learned is that is very important to take into account the production agenda and avoid schedule events in periods of high demand for labor in the field. For next year, the project is massively working in provide digital trainings in social networks, specially by CanaTube, to achieve more farmers.

title.narrative: # of farmers/miners/workers (m/f) trained to adopt good practices

comment.narrative: The original goal of 200 for 2020 refers to the second year of the project. However, due to delays, the project will be actually in year 1 of implementation in 2020. The original goal for Year 1 was 60 producers. We reduced this 60 figure to 30 producers who will be trained, given the impacts of Covid-19 on field visits.

title.narrative: # of producers and miners (M/F/youth) that implement Good Practices

comment.narrative: Considering the crises of the orange sector, Solidaridad was not able to develop an assistance program for famers. However, the year of 2018 was a strategic year for the orange project. We built new strategies to approach new partners. We participated on a task force that visited producers and sectorial organizations, like Fundecitrus, together with international industry members, like Coca-cola, Innocent, and other chain members, like Cutrale. Also, we were accepted as a member on the Brazilian Citrus Chamber on the Ministry of Agriculture. We are current building a proposal for a pre-competitive sectorial project, engaging 600 orange partners, to be presented on the chamber���������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������s next meeting on 12th March 2019. This project has already the interest from Coca-cola, Innocent and Cutrale.

title.narrative: # of producers and miners (M/F/youth) that implement Good Practices

comment.narrative: Cocoa 100 is a cumulative result from 2018 and 45 are new.

title.narrative: # of producers and miners (M/F/youth) that implement Good Practices

comment.narrative: Sugarcane ELO: 906 - 861 cumulative from 2018 Method: sum of of producers who have given the expected answer for 80% or more for the set of questions the compose the indicator (list of questions available under request.) From Jan/19 to March/19 the data was collected through RHES, while from April to December, through ES. The number is the sum of both results. Obs1: if the farmer was assessed in both platform, only ES result is accounted; Obs2: we consider the farmers the have answered 80% or more of questions that compose the indicator. Obs3: Not applicable = compliance. Sugarcane MC: 0 Results explanation: the farmers adherence to the Farming Solution app was less than expected what negatively affected the KPI. Also, the use of Extension Solution app started in the last quarter of 2019. So, the extensionists just visited the farmers once to make the diagnosis. The follow-up visits to understand the implemented practices will start in 2020.

title.narrative: # of producers and miners (M/F/youth) that implement Good Practices

comment.narrative: The original goal of 200 for 2020 refers to the second year of the partnership with Cutrale and Coca Cola. However, due to delays, the partnership will be actually in year 1 of implementation in 2020. The original goal for Year 1 was 60 producers. We reduced this 60 figure to 10 farmers to take into account the impacts of Covid-19 on the project. We have not started to use the ES tool in 2020 because of the pandemic. This number will increase only after the trainings have been done, which are delayed as well.

title.narrative: # of producers and miners (M/F/youth) that implement Good Practices

comment.narrative: Cumulative Achievement AP 2020= 145 . We have mantained the same result from 2019 because we had problems to measure the 2020 achievements for Cocoa and due pandemic situation we could not improve our impact.

So, we exceeded the targets for the year in this KPI

title.narrative: # farmers/miners (m/f) that obtain services by strengthened service providers

comment.narrative: MudaCana: 6,588 farmers Absolute = 3991 Cumulative = 2597 Score methodology 20% of members of associations with MOU signed + 70% of 30% of CanaTube's unique viewers. -20% is the average number of associates served. - As it is not possible to identify the farmers who watched CanaTube videos, we adopted the following methodology: we consider that 30% of CanaTube's unique viewers are farmers, based on a measurement of communication that this is the % of farmers who access the videos via WhatsApp links. Of these, we consider only 70% to try to avoid double counting with the 20% counting of associates.

title.narrative: Proven good practices in agriculture, mining & industry available
# of tools and models that facilitate the implementation of GP developed and tes

comment.narrative: Sugarcane: content for Extension Solution, content for Farming Solution, "climate-smart" add-on, dashboards for TopCana (Socicana) and Mudacana (Afcop) Cocoa: content for Extension Solution and FarmingSolution mobile applications

title.narrative: # of tools and models that facilitate the implementation of GP developed and tes

comment.narrative: Sugarcane ELO: 5 - Content for ES: 1 - Dashboards: 3 set of dashboards covering topics such management, field operations, Ra������������������������������������������������������zen' Sustainability KPIs, evolution and interactions. (a dashboard is not only one screen, but a set of visualizations, in one screen or more, that helps the partner to make better decisions on different topics) - CSI: review of the CSI methodology and assessment of Ra������������������������������������������������������zen results under the new CSI method. Muda Cana (156) Should be also considered as a RI Output/outcome KPI Score methodology: Sum of toolkits and contents produced by apps + dashboards - Toolkits: Farming Solution (13) + Extension Solution (12) = 25 - Dashboards = 1 - Contents for apps library = 15 - Comunication contents: CanaTube tutorial (1) + CanaTube email marketing (1) + FS and ES handbook (2) + posts in social media (95) + CanaTube videos (16) Results explanation: The digital strategy for the project was changed in 2019 that reflect in many tools and contents developed. In the beggining the tool used by Muda Cana was Farming Solution and was developed many toolkits and contents for this app. The FS tool was tested in the field but the interest of the farmers for the tool was low. In the second semester of the year the Muda Cana project start to use Extension Solution as your main digital tool and a new content was develop for ES. After we tested the ES app in a sample of 100 farmers was identified the lack of a tool to demonstrate the results of the diagnosis made by ES for the farmers association. Therefore, was hired a BI consultancy to made the dashboards.

title.narrative: # of tools and models that facilitate the implementation of GP developed and tes

comment.narrative: Total: 2, absolute (1) and cumulative (1) Cocoa dashboard and Extension Solution content

title.narrative: # of tools and models that facilitate the implementation of GP developed and tes

comment.narrative:
Total: 58 / Absolute (22) y cumulative (36)
ELO: 4 dashboards 4 cumulative
MudaCana: 54 Score methodology: 13 toolkits FS (2019) 30 toolkits ES (Toolkits are the content of Extension Solution. Each association has a separate toolkit) 3 dashboards 1 social network channel (2019) 5 apps and platforms (farmers associations) 2 models developed (1 business model for AFCOP to provide geoprocessing and production area imaging services to other associations and producers in the region; and 1 system programming model for CANAOESTE to create an web software system for sharing information and reports with producers.) 32 cumulative 22 new/absolute
